sentences.en: He spoke out unbidden at the meeting.
He walked into the room unbidden.
In a word, to let the spiritual , unbidden and unconscious , grow up through the common.
sentences.cn: 一句话, 让精神境界自发地 、 不知不觉地,在平凡的事物中扩展.

sentences.en: So, does you knee up unbidden in the night?
sentences.cn: 所以, 你的膝盖在夜间起来素不相识 吗 ?

sentences.en: The poetic element must come out of the scene as some extra and unbidden reward.
sentences.cn: 诗的成分必须来自诗人描写的情景,是一种额外的不请自来的恩酬.

sentences.en: The unbidden guest have nowhere to sit.
The words flowed unbidden from my pen.
sentences.cn: 这些字句从我的笔端滚滚流出.

sentences.en: They arrived unbidden at the midnight.
Three who come unbidden; love, jealousy, fear.
sentences.cn: 三种东西不招自来: 爱情 、 嫉妒和恐惧.

sentences.en: Unbidden guests are often welcomest when they are gone.
sentences.cn: 不速之客往往是在告辞时最受欢迎.

sentences.en: Unbidden shall it call in the night, that men may wake and gaze upon themselves.
sentences.cn: 它不邀自来,在午夜发出呼唤, 人们会醒来,审视自己.

words.tran_cn: 未受邀请的；未受指使的；自愿的

trans.tran_cn: 未被要求的，未经邀请的，非受命的，自愿的
trans.tran_en: without being asked for, expected, or invited
